flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=57>>57 photos.
When Tim has 57 photos, then Paul has 57 + 10 photos = <<57+10=67>>67 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 57 photos + 67 photos = <<57+67=124>>124 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 124 photos = <<152-124=28>>28 photos.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 52, not 57. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
